tuv.seg: Barring, safety and protection orders
Orduithe Urchoisc, Sábháilteachta agus Cosanta
Domestic violence refers to the use of physical or emotional force or threat of physical force, including sexual violence, in close adult relationships
Tagraíonn foréigean baile ar úsáid fórsa fisiciúil nó mothúchánach nó bagairt forneart fisiciúil, lena n-áirítear foréigean gnéasach, i gcaidreamh fásta dhúnadh

As well as physical violence it can also involve emotional abuse, the destruction of property, isolation from friends, family and other potential sources of support, threats to others including children, stalking, and control over access to money, personal items, food, transportation and the telephone

Chomh maith le foréigean fisiceach, is féidir foréigean baile i gceist chomh maith le mí-úsáid mhothúchánach, an scrios maoine, scoite amach ó chairde, teaghlaigh agus foinsí eile tacaíochta, bagairtí do dhaoine eile lena n-áirítear leanaí, stalcaireacht, agus smacht ar rochtain ar airgead, míreanna pearsanta, bia, iompar agus ar an teileafón
Under the Domestic Violence Act 1996, Gardaí (the Irish police force) have the power to arrest and prosecute a violent family member
Faoi An tAcht um Fhoréigean Baile, 1996, tá cumas ag na Gardaí (fórsa póilíneachta na hÉireann) ball foréigneach teaghlaigh a ghabháil
Under the law there are two main kinds of protection available, a safety order and a barring order
Dé réir an dlí tá dhá príomhchineál cosanta le fáil, ordú sábháilteachta agus ordú urchoisc
A safety order is an order of the court which prohibits the violent person from further violence or threats of violence
Is ordú cúirte ordú sábháilteachta a chuireann cosc ar dhuine foréigneach ar fhoréigean breise nó ar bhagairt foréigin
It does not oblige the person to leave the family home
Ní bhíonn iallach ar an duine áras an teaghlaigh a fhágáil
If the person is not living with you it prohibits them from watching or being near your home
Má chónaíonn sibh óna chéile tá cosc orthu ar fhaire a dhéanamh ar d’áras nó bheith cóngarach do d’áras
A safety order can last up to 5 years
Is féidir le hordú sábháilte a mhair suas go 5 bliana
A barring order is an order which requires the violent person to leave the family home
Is ordú urchoisc ordú a éilíonn ar an duine foréigneach áras an teaghlaigh a fhágáil
The order also prohibits the person from further violence or threats of violence, and from watching or being near your home
Cuireann sé cosc ar an duine ar fhoréigean breise nó ar bhagairt foréigin, agus ar fhaire a dhéanamh ar d’áras nó bheith cóngarach do d’áras
A barring order can last up to 3 years
Is féidir le hordú urchoisc a mhair suas go 3 bliana
Applying for an order
Ag déanamh iarratais ar ordú
To get a barring order or a safety order you must attend a District Court hearing
Chun ordú urchoisc nó ordú sábháilteachta a fháil ní mór duit freastal ar éisteacht chúirte
While you are waiting for the court to hear your application, the court can give you an immediate order called a protection order
Agus tú ag fanacht ar an chúirt le héisteacht le d’iarratas, is féidir leis an chúirt ordú láithreach a thabhairt duit ar a dtugtar ordú cosanta
The protection order has the same effect as a safety order
Is ionann an t-éifeacht leis an ordú cosanta agus ordú sábháilteachta
In exceptional circumstances the court can grant an interim barring order
I gcúinsí eisceachtúil is féidir leis an chúirt ordú urchoisc eatramhach a bhronnadh
This is an immediate order, requiring the violent person to leave the family home
Is ordú láithreach é seo, a éilíonn ar an duine foréigneach áras an teaghlaigh a fhágáil
The safety order or the barring order can be renewed by applying for a further order before the previous one has expired
Is féidir na horduithe a athnuachan trí chur i bhfeidhm ar ordú eile sula mbeidh an ceann roimhe sin in éag
The court will grant an order where it believes that your safety or welfare, or the safety or welfare of a dependant, requires that an order is granted
Beidh an chúirt ordú a dheonú i gcás go gcreideann sé go n-éilíonn do shábháilteacht nó do leas, nó sábháilteacht nó leas an cleithiúnaí, go bhfuil an ordaithe a deonaíodh
Under the legislation, welfare includes both physical and psychological welfare
Faoin reachtaíocht, áirítear leas an dá leas fisiciúil agus síceolaíoch
Spouses and civil partners
Céilí agus páirtnéirí sibhialta

If you are married or in a civil partnership, and you can show the court that your spouse/civil partner is violent in any way towards you or the children, you can get a barring or safety order against them no matter how long you have lived together and even if they own most or all of the house

Má tá tú pósta nó i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta, agus más féidir leat léiriú don chúirte go bhfuil do chéile foréigneach i ndóigh ar bith duit nó do na leanaí, is féidir leat ordú sábháilteachta nó ordú urchoisc a fháil ina aghaidh/haghaidh is cuma cá fhad a raibh sibh in bhur gcónaí le chéile agus fiú más leis/léi iomlán nó cuid den áras
If you have lived together in an intimate and committed relationship you can get a safety order against a violent partner
Is féidir ordú sábháilteachta a fháil in aghaidh páirtnéir atá foréigneach má tá tú i do chónaí le chéile i caidreamh pearsanta agus tiomanta
You can also get a safety order against a person with whom you have had a child but are not living with or have never lived with
Is féidir leat freisin ordú sábháilteachta a fháil in aghaidh duine a bhuil leanbh agat leis/leí, fiú mura bhfuil tú i do chónaí leis an duine nó riamh

You can get a barring order against a violent partner if you have been living together in an intimate and committed relationship for six out of the previous nine months and your partner does not own most or all of the house you are living in

Is féidir ordú urchoisc a fháil in aghaidh páirtnéir atá foréigneach má tá tú i do chónaí le chéile i caidreamh pearsanta agus tiomanta ar feadh sé mhí as naoi mí agus mura leisean / léisean an t-iomlán nó an chuid is mó den áras ina bhfuil sibh in bhur gcónaí
A parent can apply for a barring or safety order against domestic violence from their own child if their child is over 18
Is féidir le tuismitheoir ordú sábháilteachta nó ordú urchoisc a fháil in aghaidh foréigean baile a linbh féin má tá an leanbh sin níos mó ná 18
You cannot get a barring order if your child owns all or most of the house you are living in
Ní féidir leat ordú urchoisc a fháil má úinéireacht do leanbh go léir nó an chuid is mó ar an teach tú i do chónaí i
Others living together, for example, two relatives, can apply for a safety order
Is féidir le daoine eile chur isteach ar ordú, mar shampla, is féidir le beirt ghaol atá ina gcónaí le chéile bheith clúdaithe
Child and Family Agency
Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach
The Child and Family Agency may seek a safety or barring order against a violent adult on behalf of a child, whether or not that violent adult is married to the child's parent

Is féidir leis an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach ordú urchoisc a iarraidh in aghaidh duine fásta atá foréigneach ar son linbh, má tá nó mura bhfuil an duine sin pósta le tuismitheoir an linbh
The law in Ireland strictly provides that anyone who contravenes a safety, barring (or interim barring) or protection order is guilty of an offence
Dianfhorálann dlí na hÉireann go bhfuil duine ar bith a sháraíonn ordú sábháilteachta, urchoisc (nó urchoisc eatramhach) nó cosanta ciontach i gcion

Furthermore, if someone prevents you or your dependents from entering or remaining in a place to which the order relates (while the barring or interim barring order is in effect), they are also guilty of an offence

Ina theannta sin, má chuireann duine cosc ort nó ar do chleithiúnaithe ar dhul isteach nó ar chead fhanacht in áit lena mbaineann an t-ordú (agus an t-ordú urchoisc nó urchoisc eatramhach ina éifeacht), tá siadsan ciontach i gcion chomh maith
The above offences under the Domestic Violence Act 1996 are punishable by a Class B fine and/or a prison term of 12 months
Is inphionósaithe faoi fíneáil aicme B nó faoi théarma príosúin de 12 mhí nó an bheirt acu araon na cionta thuas luaite faoin Acht um Fhoréigean Bhaile 1996
These penalties are set down in Section 17 of the Domestic Violence Act, 1996
Tá na pionóis seo leagtha síos in Alt 17 den Acht um Fhoréigean Bhaile, 1996
If you are concerned about violence in your home, you should contact your local Garda Station
Má bhíonn imní ort faoi fhoréigean sa bhaile, ní mór duit dul i dteagmháil le do Stáisiúin na nGardaí Áitiúil
Members of the Gardaí are specially trained to deal with these situations and can offer advice, information and assistance
Tá oiliúint ar leith ag baill na nGardaí le plé leis na cásanna seo agus thig leo comhairle, eolas agus cúnamh a thabhairt
Your local Citizens Information Centre can give you information about organisations that will provide you with support
Is féidir le do Lárionad Eolais do Shaoránaigh áitiúil eolas a thabhairt duit ar eagraíochtaí a sholáthróidh tacaíocht duit
For example, two such organisations are Women's Aid and Amen Support Services
Mar shampla, is iad Women’s Aid agus Amen Support Services a leithid d’eagraíochtaí seo
Women's Aid is a voluntary organisation providing support and information to women and their children who are being physically, emotionally and sexually abused in their own homes
Is eagraíocht deonach é Woman’s Aid a thugann tacaíocht agus eolas do mhná agus dona leanaí a n-imrítear drochíde fhisiceach, mhothúchánach agus ghnéasach orthu ina sa bhaile
If you are a woman living in a violent situation, you should contact the Women's Aid helpline on 1800 341900
Más bean thú atá i do chónaí i gcás foréigneach, ní mór duit dul i dteagmháil le Líne Chabhrach Women’s Aid ar 1800 341900
Amen Support Services is a voluntary organisation which provides a confidential helpline, a support service and information for male victims of domestic abuse
Is eagraíocht deonach é Amen Support Services a thugann líne chabhrach atá faoi rún, seirbhís tacaíochta agus eolas d'íospartaigh fhireannach fhoréigean bhaile
You can contact Amen Support Services by phone at (046) 902 3718
Thig leat dul i dteagmháil le Amen Support Services trí ghlaoch a chur ar (046) 902 3718

Further information on domestic and sexual violence as well as information on local and national support services is available on the website of Cosc - The National Office for the Prevention of Domestic, Sexual and Gender-based Violence

Tá tuilleadh eolais ar fhoréigean teaghlaigh agus gnéis chomh maith le faisnéis faoi sheirbhísí tacaíochta áitiúla agus náisiúnta ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin na Cosc - An Oifig Náisiúnta um Chosc Fhoréigean Baile, Gnéasach agus Inscnebhunaithe
To apply for a barring order or a safety order you must go to your local District Court Office
Chun chur isteach ar ordú urchoisc nó ar ordú sábháilteachta ní mór duit dul chuig do Oifig Chúirt Dúiche áitiúil
If you live in the Dublin Area you must go to the Dublin District Family Law Office (see 'Where to apply' below)
Má tá tú i do chónaí i i Mórcheantar Bhaile Átha Cliath ní mór duit dul chuig Oifig um Dlí Teaghlaigh Chathair Bhaile Átha Cliath (Féach ‘Áit chun chur isteach’ thíos)
However, you can go to the Dublin District Court Offices in Swords if it is closer to you
Thig leat dul chuig Oifigí Cúirte Dúiche i Sord má tá sé níos cóngaraí duit
When you get to the District Court Office, the Court staff will identify the forms you need to make your application
Nuair a fhaigheann tú go dtí an Oifig na Cúirte Dúiche, beidh foireann na Cúirte a aithint na foirmeacha is gá duit a dhéanamh d'iarratas
You do not need a solicitor to make an initial application, but it is recommend you have legal representation for a full court hearing
Ní gá duit aturnae a iarratas a dhéanamh, ach moltar go bhfuil tú ionadaíocht dlí le héisteacht cúirte iomlán
You must bring proof of your identity, such as a passport or driver's licence
Ní mór duit a thabhairt cruthúnas aitheantais a thabhairt, mar shampla pas nó ceadúnas tiomána
You should mention any evidence you have for the full hearing, including reports from your GP, hospital or the Gardaí
Ba chóir duit a lua aon fhianaise a bhfuil tú ar an éisteacht iomlán, lena n-áirítear tuairiscí ó do dhochtúir teaghlaigh, ospidéal nó na Gardaí
If you are applying for a barring order or a safety order, the court clerk will arrange a court date for a court hearing
Má tá tú ag cur isteach ar ordú urchoisc nó ordú sábháilteachta socróidh cléireach na cúirte dáta cúirte le haghaidh chúirt éisteachta
You will be given your summons for the court hearing at the time of your application
Tógfar do thoghairm don éisteacht cúirte duit ag am d'iarratais
A summons will be sent to the respondent by ordinary post
Seolfar toghairm chuig an fhreagróir trí ghnáthphost
The respondent is the person you need to be protected from or want barred from your home
Is é an freagróir an duine óna bhfuil cosaint de dhíth ort nó ar mian leat urchoisc a chur ó d’áras
While you are waiting to go to court to get your barring order or safety order, you can get a protection order or an interim barring order immediately
Agus tú ag fanacht ar dhul os comhair na cúirte chun ordú urchoisc nó ordú sábháilteachta a fháil, thig leat ordú cosanta nó ordú urchoisc eatramhach a fháil láithreach
If you want a protection order or an interim barring order the District Court Judge will hear your case on the day you make your application for a barring order or safety order
Má maith leat ordú cosanta nó ordú urchoisc eatramhach éistfidh Breitheamh na Cúirte Dúiche do chás ar an lá a chuireann tú d’iarratas isteach ar ordú urchoisc nó ordú sábháilteachta
If you do not want a protection order or an interim barring order immediately, you can seek one at any time before your case is heard for a barring or safety order
Mura maith leat ordú cosanta nó ordú urchoisc eatramhach láithreach is féidir leat ceann acu a iarraidh ag am ar bith roimh éisteacht do cháis le haghaidh ordú urchoisc nó ordú sábháilteachta
When you get your barring order, safety order, protection order or interim barring order, you show it to the Gardaí in your local Garda Station
Nuair a fhaigheann tú d’ordú urchoisc, ordú sábháilteachta, ordú cosanta nó ordú urchoisc eatramhach taispeánann tú do na Gardaí é i do Stáisiún na nGardaí áitiúil
Do not give them your order (you can allow them to take a photocopy). A copy of your order will be sent to the Superintendent of your local Garda Station by registered post the following day
Ná tabhair dóibh d’ordú (thig leat cead a thabhairt dóibh fótachóip a dhéanamh de) Seolfar cóip do d’ordú chuig Cheannfort do Stáisiún na nGardaí áitiúil trí phost cláraithe an lá dar gceann

A safety order, barring order, interim barring order or protection order takes effect from the time the respondent is notified of the order. This can be done verbally, together with the production of a copy of the order

Cuirtear ordú sábháilteachta, ordú urchoisc, ordú urchoisc eatramhach nó ordú cosanta i gcrith ón am a gcuirtear an t-ordú in iúl don fhreagróir Thig leis seo bheith déanta de bhriathar, in éineacht le cóip an ordaithe a thabhairt
If the respondent is in court when the order is made the respondent is considered to be notified
Má bhíonn an freagróir sa chúirt ag am a ndéantar an t-ordú glactar leis go bhfuil sé curtha in iúl don fhreagróir
A copy of the order will be sent to the respondent by ordinary post
Seolfar cóip den ordú chuig an fhreagróir trí ghnáthphost
In some cases, the Judge may direct the Gardaí 'to serve' the order on the respondent
I gcásanna áirithe, is féidir leis an Breitheamh na Gardaí a threorú leis an ordú ‘a seirbheáil’ ar an fhreagróir
This means the Gardaí will hand the order directly to the respondent
Ciallaíonn sé seo go dtabharfaidh na Gardaí an t-ordú go díreach i lámh an fhreagróra
